instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-A  strange power button issue
threads.message:
The power button works.   If you press it you turn on the machine.    If you hold it you turn off the machine.
>> if you quick press it << you freeze the machine and lock it up. 

My guess is I have a CPU FET problem but I don't have much experience with these older machines.

threads.title: 820-4924-A  strange power button issue
threads.message:
Do you need a very short press time?
Can that be done accidentally by the client?
SMC reset restart it from that stage?

threads.title: 820-4924-A  strange power button issue
threads.message:
quick tap at any point freezes it.
I can power cycle the machine by holding and duplicate at will

I can remove power and power on with mag safe.  And when it boots up if I quick tap the power button it's frozen
If I don't touch it that machine runs fine.

threads.title: 820-4924-A  strange power button issue
threads.message:
Tried PRAM reset?

SMC_ONOFF_L recovers instantly after such short press, or has some delay on low level?
Same thing happens if acting rapidly over R5116 pads, instead of power button?
